grounding: The COVID-19 pandemic has arguably been one of the worst global catastrophes over the last several decades. A plethora of real-time research has been produced by the finance profession to try and understand the impact COVID-19 had on financial markets. In this issue, the Annual Review of Financial Economics provides five articles, all touching on different aspects of the COVID-19 crisis. This introductory article provides a brief review of these articles.
generated_text: This paper explores the intersection of financial economics and the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing on the impact of epidemiological models on financial stability and markets. It examines shifts in household behavior and the implications for fixed income securities. By analyzing these dynamics, the study provides insights into the resilience and adaptability of financial systems in the face of unprecedented global health crises, offering a comprehensive overview of the pandemic's economic ramifications.
